title: Help identify this type from an antique map
content:
i’d like to use some type inspired by antique maps for a branding project and this is a good example of the typography i’d like to use. i like the contrast between thick and thin much like bodoni or didot, but the serifs extend out a bit further and are a bit more wedge-like. can some one help me find something pretty close to this?

thanks

austin taylor

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071222213314im_/http:/typophile.com/files/maptext_6058.jpg)

 [‹ Looking for freeware fonts similar to these](http://web.archive.org/web/20071222213314/http:/typophile.com/node/38064 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Yarck Cocksfoot italic compact sans - Antique Olive Nord {Akira} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071222213314/http:/typophile.com/node/38193 "Go to next forum topic")
author: aust.taylor
